skill.name: skill-i18n
skill.description: Translate SKILL.md and README.md files into multiple languages for sharing skills internationally
skill.summary: Automate translation of skill documentation into multiple languages
skill.author: guo-yu

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All 337 static findings are false positives triggered by code examples in markdown documentation. The skill describes a translation tool but contains no actual implementation code.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: .gitignore is specifically designed to EXCLUDE files from version control. Listing database files here is a security best practice, not a risk. This protects against accidentally committing sensitive database files.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:14-217 (225 occurrences)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: All shell command examples appear in markdown code blocks as documentation/examples, not as executable code. This is a documentation-only repository describing a translation tool. No actual command execution occurs.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] filesystem: Hidden file in home directory at SKILL.md:32 (9 occurrences)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: References to ~/.claude/ paths are in documentation examples showing configuration file locations. These are descriptive references, not actual file operations. No filesystem access occurs.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at SKILL.md:3 (23 occurrences)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: The static analyzer misidentified language codes (zh-CN, ja, ko, es) and configuration strings as cryptographic algorithms. These are legitimate language identifiers and configuration values in documentation examples.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] obfuscation: High file entropy (6.26 bits) at SKILL.ja.md:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: High entropy in Japanese translation file is normal for UTF-8 encoded Japanese characters. This is expected behavior for internationalized content, not obfuscation.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] obfuscation: High file entropy (6.06 bits) at SKILL.zh-CN.md:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: High entropy in Chinese translation file is normal for UTF-8 encoded Chinese characters. This is expected behavior for internationalized content, not obfuscation.

content.user_title: Translate skill documentation to multiple languages
content.value_statement: This skill automates translation of skill documentation files into multiple languages. It generates localized SKILL.md files for Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Spanish, making skills accessible to international users.
actual_capabilities: Translate SKILL.md and README.md files to supported languages
Generate language-specific output files with proper naming conventions
Store and manage per-skill translation configurations
Support command-line flags for integration with other skills
limitations: Requires external translation service or manual translation work
Does not translate code blocks, file paths, or technical identifiers
First run requires interactive language selection via TUI
Language support depends on configured translation targets

use_cases.title: Publish skills globally
use_cases.description: Translate skill documentation to reach international users who prefer their native language

use_cases.title: Maintain multi-language docs
use_cases.description: Generate and update localized documentation files automatically when source files change

use_cases.title: Automate documentation pipeline
use_cases.description: Call skill-i18n from other skills to generate translations as part of documentation workflows

prompt_templates.title: Translate current skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /skill-i18n to translate the SKILL.md file to configured languages

prompt_templates.title: Translate specific skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /skill-i18n port-allocator to translate the port-allocator skill to its configured languages

prompt_templates.title: Configure defaults
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /skill-i18n config to configure default languages and files for new translations

prompt_templates.title: Automated translation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /skill-i18n --lang zh-CN,ja --files SKILL.md --no-prompt to translate without interactive prompts

output_examples.input: Run /skill-i18n in the port-allocator skill directory

output: Translated SKILL.md to Korean and Spanish
Translated README.md to Korean and Spanish

best_practices: Configure default languages once using /skill-i18n config to avoid repeated prompts
Use the --no-prompt flag when integrating skill-i18n into automated workflows
Preserve code blocks and technical identifiers which are explicitly excluded from translation
anti_patterns: Running translation without checking that the source SKILL.md contains translateable content
Expecting code examples and file paths to be translated (they are preserved by design)
Skipping the initial configuration when you plan to translate multiple skills regularly

faq.question: Which languages are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Chinese (zh-CN), Japanese (ja), Korean (ko), and Spanish (es) with custom language codes for additional languages.

faq.question: Does it translate code examples?
faq.answer: No, code blocks, file paths, command names, and URLs are preserved unchanged during translation.

faq.question: How are translations triggered?
faq.answer: Use /skill-i18n for current directory, /skill-i18n <name> for specific skills, or configure --lang and --files flags.

faq.question: Where is configuration stored?
faq.answer: Settings are stored in ~/.claude/skill-i18n-config.json with per-skill language and file preferences.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, use command-line flags like --lang, --files, --skill, and --no-prompt for automated integration.

faq.question: Does it overwrite existing translations?
faq.answer: By default it detects existing files and prompts. Use --overwrite flag to skip confirmation and replace files.
